work/game-builder/src/cache/image-cache.js

image-cache.js

By Diego Enrique Marquez

Find me on Github

Inherits from:

Depends of:

A requireJS module. For use with Game-Builder

This module takes care of creating HTMLImageElements to load image data. Each image is saved under a key, if the same image is requested again, it can be re used instead of creating a new one and loading it again.

The HTMLImageElements are never attached to the DOM, so they are not visible. The purpose of this cache is to have the data available to draw it on a CanvasRenderingContext2D

Cache Images

define(function() { var cache = {}; var ImageCache = function() {};

cache

Parameters:

  • id must be a String.
    (Path to the image asset to load, can be a local or remote url)
ImageCache.prototype.cache = function(path) { if (cache[path]) { return; } var image = document.createElement('img'); image.src = path; cache[path] = image; };

get

Parameters:

  • id must be a String.
    (Path used to retrieve a cached HTMLImageElements)

Returns an Object
(Cached HTMLImageElements)

ImageCache.prototype.get = function(path) { return cache[path]; };

clear

Parameters:

  • id must be a String.
    (Path to the HTMLImageElements to clear from the cache)
ImageCache.prototype.clear = function(path) { delete cache[path]; };

clearAll

ImageCache.prototype.clearAll = function() { for(var k in cache) { delete cache[k]; } };

toString

String representation of the cache

ImageCache.prototype.toString = function() { var r = {} r['cachedImages'] = cache.keys().length; r['images'] = []; for(var k in cache) { r['images'].push(k); } return JSON.stringify(r, null, 2); };
return new ImageCache(); });
